newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine Jan-Sept GDP falls 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine Jan-Sept GDP falls 10 pct.

text.p: Ukraine's gross domestic product in the first nine months of this year was 10 percent lower than the same period a year earlier, the Statistics Ministry said on Tuesday.
Economy Minister Vasyl Hureyev predicted last week that GDP over the whole of this year will show a 7.9 percent decline compared to a drop of 11.8 percent in 1995.
The 1997 draft budget calls for GDP growth of 1.7 percent, which would be the first growth since Ukraine won independence five years ago.
